Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
What does this sign mean?

Answers.Answer: A rest area is 70 metres ahead
Do not stop for the next 70 metres

Question: When a flock of sheep are coming towards you on a country road, what should you do?

Answers.Answer: Sound the horn on your vehicle to move them out the way
Slow down or pull over to the side of the road
Turn on your vehicle hazard lights and drive on
Drive down the centre of the road

Question: What is the meaning of a yellow broken line painted on the road near the kerb?

Answers.Answer: You may stop for no more than 5 minutes

Question: To help you from being blinded by the headlights of an oncoming vehicle, what should you do?

Answers.Answer: Look to the left-hand side of the road
Look to the right-hand side of the road
Look to the centre of the road
Turn the headlights of your vehicle onto high beam

Question: What must you do when turning right at a roundabout?

Answers.Answer: Not indicate at any time on the roundabout
Indicate left before entering the roundabout
Indicate right before entering the roundabout
Indicate right when leaving the roundabout

Question: Can medication from your doctor affect your driving?
What must you do before turning left into a driveway?

Answers.Answer: Check the driveway is clear and enter
Signal only if there is a vehicle behind you and enter
Signal for 3 seconds or more and if the driveway is clear, enter
Signal only if another vehicle is coming towards you and enter

Question: What must you do when you see blue and red flashing lights behind you?

Answers.Answer: Speed up to get out of the way
Slow down and drive on carefully

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
If you have had a flat tyre and have fitted a ‘space saver wheel’ what must you do?

Answers.Answer: Drive directly to a place where the flat tyre can be repaired and replaced
Drive at 40km/h until the flat tyre has been repaired
Lower the pressure in the other tyres

Question: What does this sign mean?

Answers.Answer: There has been a crash – slow down to 20km/h when passing this sign until you have passed the crash
There have been crashes here in the past – slow down
There has been a crash – but the road is clear now
This is an accident black spot

Question: What does a white diamond painted on the road mean?
If you are going straight through a roundabout don’t signal as you come up to the roundabout, only signal left as you pass the exit before the one you wish to take.
What is the maximum legal speed limit for a car towing a trailer on the open road?
What is the best way to check for hazards before reversing your vehicle?

Answers.Answer: Relying only on the outside mirrors
Turning to look over your shoulders
Relying only on the inside mirrors
Walking around the vehicle before reversing

Question: When must you pull over and allow an ambulance or fire engine to pass?

Answers.Answer: When it is operating its siren or flashing lights
When it is turning right and you have the right of way

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
When coming up to a one-lane bridge, what does this sign indicate?

Answers.Answer: Others should give way to you

Question: You are the driver of the blue car. What must you do?

Answers.Answer: Speed up to get around in front of the cyclist
Keep driving as the cyclist has to give way to larger vehicles
Sound the warning device to warn the cyclist
Stop and give way to the cyclist

Question: The bonnet of your vehicle lifts up while you are driving and you cannot see. What should you do?

Answers.Answer: Turn your vehicle headlights on and look out of the side window
Brake smoothly and move over to the left side of the road
Steer your vehicle straight ahead and stop as quickly as you can
Speed up and move to the left side of the road

Question: Passengers in your vehicle are 15 years or over. Who is responsible for making sure they wear a safety belt (seat belt)?

Answers.Answer: You as the driver of the vehicle

Question: Which person can legally stop and do a roadside check of your vehicle?
To tow a trailer on a restricted driver licence, the weight of your vehicle plus the weight of the trailer and its load must not exceed what weight?
You can be fined if your vehicle is on a road and not up to warrant of fitness standard.
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
What must you do if glass falls on to the road from your vehicle?

Answers.Answer: Sweep it up straight away if you can do so safely

Question: What does ‘the speed limit’ mean?

Answers.Answer: The slowest speed you can drive in good conditions
The fastest speed you can drive in good conditions
The average speed you can drive in good conditions
The fastest speed you can drive, except when overtaking

Question: What does one or more yellow lights flashing at traffic signals mean?

Answers.Answer: Be careful and apply the give way rule
Drive on but increase your speed
Stop until the lights no longer flash
Move to the left-hand side of the road

Question: What is the least distance of clear road you MUST have in front of you when you have finished passing another vehicle?
When driving on an unlaned road, where should your vehicle be positioned?

Answers.Answer: Anywhere, so long as you can see what is coming
Close to the centre of the road
As close to the left side of the road as possible

Question: For the purpose of applying the give way rule, entrance ways into public car parks should be treated as:
What does this sign mean?

Answers.Answer: Do not drive faster than 50km/h unless the road is clear
There is a rest area 50 metres ahead
